Question
========

A researcher ran a one-way ANOVA (one factor) with 5 groups. The F-test of the ANOVA with the 5 groups is significant at a significance level of 0.05. The researcher then wants to see which of the groups differ from each other. To do so, she wants to correct for *multiple comparison* with Bonferroni. She must then divide her significance level divided by the total number of tests, or 0.05/*k*. In this setup

Answerlist
----------

* K = 5.
* K = 10.
* K = 15.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* K = 5.: Incorrect
* K = 10.: Correct
* K = 15.: Incorrect
